intro: Psychotria temehaniensis, commonly known as the Temehani Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of Ecuador. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It is typically found in humid, shaded environments within the understorey of tropical forests. Due to its restricted distribution and limited research, it remains a relatively understudied species within its ecological niche.
